author: ExpressDigest
title: Jewish New Yorker who survived Hamas attack at Nova Music Festival hugs the man who saved her after she had been running away from terrorists 'for four hours' in touching reunion | Express Digest
text: A Jewish New Yorker who survived the Hamas attack at the Nova Music Festival has reunited with the man who saved her life. Natalie Sanandaji, 28, returned to Israel for the first time since the harrowing October 7 massacre and met Israeli hero Moshe Sati, who, alongside his son, rescued more than 100 festival-goers, including herself, by driving into the terrorist attack multiple times, transporting them to safety. In the touching reunion filmed by CNN, the two embrace each other while Sati can be seen tearing up. Sanandaji, who only recently learned Sati’s name, expressed deep gratitude, describing him as one of the kindest souls she has ever met. Despite Sati’s modesty and reluctance for recognition, Sanandaji considers herself fortunate for his selfless actions, emphasizing that he is known in his hometown for always helping others without hesitation. Natalie Sanandaji, 28, returned to Israel for the first time since the harrowing October 7 massacre and met hero Moshe Sati, who saved her life Israeli hero Moshe Sati, who, alongside his son, rescued more than 100 festival-goers by driving into the terrorist attack multiple times, transporting them to safety In the touching reunion filmed by CNN , the two embrace each other while Sati can be seen tearing up Sati’s son, an observant Jew who celebrates the Sabbath – meaning, he cannot drive or work on Saturday, joined his father in the rescue mission despite these limitations. Sanandaji recounted the emotional reunion, capturing the genuine bond formed between them due to the shared trauma. She said Sati’s acts of heroism went beyond expectations. Despite the terrifying ordeal at the festival, Sanandaji conveyed feeling safer in Israel than in the United States. She voiced concerns over the rise in anti-Semitic incidents in the US, particularly in her hometown of New York, citing various acts of hate targeting the Jewish community. Sanandaji ran for her life while getting gunned down by terrorists on October 7, ultimately surviving the horrific massacre. Although she made it out alive and returned to her home in Long Island a week later, she said she does not feel any safer back in the US. On October 7, she and three friends were camping overnight at the Supernova Sukkot Gathering near Re’im, an event billed as a night of ‘friends, love and infinite freedom’ to celebrate the Jewish holiday of Sukkot with electronic music. On the first evening, nothing was out of the ordinary. But moments before dawn broke on Saturday, explosions appeared in the sky. ‘We were woken up by one of our friends who came to tell us some rockets had been sent over.’ For many of her friends, this is normal. ‘But this is not something that I am used to seeing.’ In October, Sanandaji told DailyMail.com many were still in the crowd dancing when the first salvoes of rockets passed overhead. For a time, it was not clear what was happening. Some festival-goers were seen walking away from the disruption. Others carried on, unaware. Despite the terrifying ordeal at the festival, Sanandaji conveyed feeling safer in Israel than in the United States ‘Many people who were in the crowd had told me that they thought the noises were coming from the music,’ Natalie said. ‘After a few minutes, we started to realize that the rockets just kept coming and kept coming and kept coming. Though first time I really realized how severe the situation was becoming was when they shut off the music.’ Security guards reacted quickly, at first telling guests to get down and cover their faces. As the missiles closed in, they told guests to pack what they could and evacuate as soon as possible. ‘They were there until the end,’ Natalie explained. ‘Most of them had died, guiding us and trying to get us to safety.’ ‘Everybody started driving in one direction. There was traffic from so many cars being in such a confined space all trying to leave at the same time. ‘Even at that point, in my head I was thinking, “OK, if it’s just rockets, if they’re not in our vicinity, we have the Iron Dome. Some scrap from intercepted rockets could hit our cars. But we’ll be in our cars. We’ll be okay. We’ll get out of here. It might take a few hours because there’s so many people, but we’ll be fine.” ‘When we started driving in one direction, security started telling people to drive in another direction. That’s when we realized that there must be something else going on other than just the rockets. ‘Security started yelling at everybody “get out of your cars,” “park your cars on the side of the dirt road and run!” ‘I didn’t understand why at first… and then we heard the first gunshots.’ Within moments, gunmen had entered the festival on motorbikes, in vans and by motorized paraglider and started shooting at the event’s 3,500 attendees with Kalashnikov assault rifles. At least 260 people died in the massacre, with many victims shot in the back as they tried to run. Countless were injured, and many more taken back into Gaza as hostages. Natalie only knew that she had to keep moving. ‘The security told us to pull over to the side of the road: “Being in the cars is making you too easy of a target – get out of your car and start running.” Natalie Sanandaji escaped the massacre with a group of friends on Saturday, October 7, 2023 “These are the only photos I have from the festival. Obviously didn’t have much time to take any other photos or videos since we were running for our lives.” – Natalie Sanandaji, 28 Destroyed cars and personal items are still left scattered around the festival site, on October 13 ‘As soon as we heard the first gunshots… I was there with three people, we were in the car together. We opened the doors and we started running for our lives. ‘After that we just ran. I remember at a certain point there was a bit of a ditch. And we were contemplating if we should go into the ditch and hide, or if we should keep running. And we kept running. A lot of people that went into the ditch are not here today. Every decision we made ended up saving our lives. But we had… no one had any idea what decision to make. You just had to make a decision in that moment.’ ‘We ran for about four hours, on and off. In between the gunshots, anytime the gunshots would subdue for a little bit, we would say, “Okay, we’re going to, we’re going to walk a little slower, we’re going to catch our breath.” ‘The scariest thing for me was running in a certain direction – thinking that you’re running to safety – and then suddenly seeing dozens of other kids running in your direction and realizing that they’re running from a terrorist, that they are running from shooting. ‘These were innocent children. We had nothing to protect ourselves. Imagine you’re in an open field with nowhere to hide and they are coming at you from every direction. ‘Kids were running in all different directions and you had to make a split-second decision on where to run, to where you thought it would be safe. ‘And that decision would either save your life or get you killed or kidnapped.’ The group of four continued to follow the road out of Re’im. Their last instruction from camp security had been to push on to the nearest town. For miles, they walked along the banks of short grassland and fields with little in the way of protection. An Israeli officer walks around a campsite at the festival near Re’im kibbutz on October 17 ‘The scariest thing for me was running in a certain direction – thinking that you’re running to safety – and then suddenly seeing dozens of other kids running in your direction and realizing that they’re running from a terrorist, that they are running from shooting.’ Destroyed cars are seen at the party site near the Kibbutz Re’im on Tuesday, October 10, 2023 ‘The only time we had someone near us to guide us was about two hours in. We saw a police officer and his direction was to go in the direction of the sun. That was the direction the town was in.’ The police officer walked with Natalie and her group for a while, armed only with a handgun. He explained he could not call for backup because Hamas had taken over the nearby police station. Over the radio, ‘you could hear the terrorists yelling’. They could only keep moving. ‘There was just an exodus of hundreds and hundreds of kids walking in the same direction. And then every time we heard gunshots, some people ran this way, some people ran that way. ‘You’re in an open field and there’s almost nowhere to hide. It felt hopeless. It really felt hopeless. There’s just simply nowhere to hide, there was nowhere to go. There’s stories of some people that hid in drains, in trees and fields. A lot of those people… they ended up finding them and killing most of them. ‘The ones that survived were the ones that hid under the dead bodies and pretended to be dead.’ Exhausted, Natalie’s group eventually stopped to rest in the shade of a tree. Four hours had passed and they were still miles from the nearest town, an endless journey with no way to know how far they had gone. As they paused, they saw a large white van coming towards them. ‘At first we thought it might be a terrorist so we fought to get up and run… but then we realised, “where would we run to? What would we do?”‘ The group could only wait by the side of the road. The vehicle pulled up and a man got out. He offered them a lift. They still had an hour to go. Vehicles were abandoned after security guards told attendees to leave their cars and run Fleeing for their lives, people had no time to react when told the abandon their cars and run. Pictured: car keys are left in the ignition of a destroyed car at the festival on October 12 Charred and damaged cars along a desert road after an attack by Hamas militants at the Tribe of Nova Trance music festival near Kibbutz Re’im in southern Israel on Saturday, October 7 ‘The people that risked their own lives to try to save us was incredible to see. I couldn’t believe that these people were going out of their way to risk their lives to save all of us. If that man didn’t come with his car, I don’t think I would be here today. ‘It’s very hard for me to comprehend these stories that I am seeing now, every day, someone else that was kidnapped, that their friends and family had a little bit of hope that maybe they are still alive. Every day people are posting that they have been found dead.’ Natalie and her friends were fortunate to escape to Patish, a nearby moshav. There, she says the town came together to help those still flooding in. ‘They gave us food. They gave us shelter. We hid in their bomb shelters.’ She described the horror parents were undergoing all the while as they acted quickly to take in more children. ‘When the rockets started going off, all the children there were messaging their parents, telling them what was happening. To tell them that they were safe and trying to escape. ‘Many people, after a while, couldn’t get in touch with their kids anymore. Either their kids were kidnapped or killed. So a lot of people in the town were receiving lists of names of people that were at the festival that… weren’t answering their family and friends anymore. ‘And they were walking around reading off lists of names hoping that maybe somebody was saved and maybe somebody was in the shelter and then they could inform their families that they are okay.’ Natalie managed to get in touch with her mother, who lives in New York. ‘I honestly did not tell my mom where I was until after I got home safe because I couldn’t stand the idea of her worrying about me about my life that way.’ Soon after, Natalie made plans to return home, coming home via Athens. There, she contacted the press, feeling she needed to share her story. She said there is now nowhere she feels entirely safe, amid heightened reports of antisemitism globally. Anti-Jewish threats on Telegram surged 488 percent in the first 18 hours after Hamas’ incursion, according to the Anti-Defamation League. The first four days of the conflict also saw anti-Semitic incidents in the United Kingdom surge by more than 300 percent, according to Community Security Trust. ‘I have a lot of friends in New York right now who are afraid to leave their homes,’ Natalie said. ‘I had a friend who tried to call an Uber and the Uber driver messaged her and asked her, “Are you Jewish?” And then said, “If you are, I will kill you.” ‘It doesn’t feel safe to be anywhere right now. The fact that I’m not in Israel doesn’t make me feel safe. ‘I’m incredibly scared for what’s to come. Because everything that has happened so far is not the end it is only going to get worse and that’s what scares me the most.’ In spite of all she has gone through, Natalie’s message to the world is to avoid the conflict descending into further unnecessary factional violence. She says she wants people to ‘understand that we have the same common enemy’ in Hamas, as distinct from the Palestinian people. ‘[Hamas] is a terrorist organization that does not care though about the lives of Palestinian people, or any people,’ she said. ‘We have to come together against this common enemy.’ ‘I am seeing a lot of support online from a lot of countries, from a lot of governments, from a lot of people I know personally, from people I don’t know personally. But I think there is still a lot of confusion as to who Hamas is, what they are doing. ‘Especially as an Iranian Jew, just a year ago the Iranian government was killing innocent children in their own streets. And I feel that a lot of Iranians even don’t realize that we are fighting against the same people. We need to come together and realize that we have the same common enemy.’ ‘I also want people to understand the fear that Jews are feeling all over the world, whether it’s in London or Paris, or New York, or Israel. ‘The things that I’m seeing that are happening in New York – I don’t actually feel safe going home,’ she said. ‘Everyone keeps telling me “it’s so great that you’re almost back in New York, you’re almost home”. But I don’t feel safe going back to New York. ‘And that’s the scariest part. That’s the saddest part – that I don’t feel safe.’ *** [Read more at DailyMail.co.uk](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-12910307/Jewish-New-Yorker-survived-Hamas-attack-Nova-Music-Festival-hugs-rescuer.html?ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490&ito=1490)

author: Vignesh Karunanidhi
title: Surge in January 2024?
text: [Solana](https://watcher.guru/news/?s=solana) has experienced notable growth in the DeFi, NFT, and Web3 markets since its inception in April 2019. Numerous projects are currently being developed on the Solana network, with more expected to emerge soon. According to information provided on Solana’s official website, the company’s main value proposition is offering low-cost transactions indefinitely. As a blockchain network, it competes directly with other platforms, such as Ethereum. Solana has recently breached the price level of $100. According to recent data, [SOL](https://watcher.guru/news/?s=sol) has dropped by over 6% in the last 24 hours. Also read: [VeChain New Year Price Prediction: How High Can VET Go?](https://watcher.guru/news/vechain-new-year-price-prediction-how-high-can-vet-go) Even though the whole cryptocurrency market is trading in the green, Solana is trading in the red at press time. With the New Year almost here, here is our price prediction for Solana for January 2024. How high can SOL go in January 2024? Various factors, such as market conditions, price action, developments, supply, and use cases, will determine whether Solana’s SOL can shoot up in price in January 2024. Based on SOL’s behavior at the start of 2023, cryptocurrency experts at [Changelly ](https://changelly.com/blog/solana-price-prediction/)offer their price prediction for Solana for January 2024. For this timeframe, SOL’s price is anticipated to be $116. In January 2024, the minimum price is anticipated to be $103.82. The maximum price is expected to reach $128.91. Also read: [Shiba Inu: Who Owns The Highest Number of SHIB Coins?](https://watcher.guru/news/shiba-inu-who-owns-the-highest-number-of-shib-coins) According to the latest CoinMarketCap [data](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/solana/), Solana is trading at $105, with a 6% drop in value over the last 24 hours. SOL had recently surged past the $110 resistance. Amidst the market volatility, the price has dropped to the $105 level. However, prices can fluctuate and vary depending on the overall market conditions.

author: Anthony Bennett
title: 27 Color-Based Nursery Themes for Every Style & Mood - AlittleDelightful
text:
27 Color-Based Nursery Themes for Every Style & Mood
Seeking the ideal color scheme for your baby’s room?
You’re not alone! I know how challenging it can be to select colors that create the perfect mood for your little one. Most parents feel stuck between too many options with no clear starting point.
It’s tough to see how colors, themes, and decor items work together until it’s too late and you’ve already bought everything. What if there were an easier way to design a nursery that looks pulled together from the start?
I’ve sorted popular nursery themes by color families to help you create a space that feels just right. Let’s examine how the right color can make all the difference in your baby’s first room.
How to Choose the Perfect Nursery Theme?
Selecting the right nursery theme creates a happy and peaceful space for you and your baby. The theme affects everything from wall colors to decor choices. A good theme makes you smile every time you walk into the room.
- Pick what makes you happy – Choose themes that bring you joy. Your positive feelings will naturally fill the room.
- Select mood-setting colors – Use soft blues and greens for calm spaces. Try sunny yellows and corals for a playful, cheerful look in your rooms.
- Plan for the future – Some themes are suitable only for babies. Others, like animals or nature, grow with your child for years.
- Match your home style – Choose themes that complement your existing decor. This creates better harmony throughout your house.
- Consider room size – Small rooms need light colors and simple designs. Large spaces can handle bold patterns and darker shades.
- Think practically – Choose themes with items you can find in stores or make yourself. This keeps decorating simple and budget-friendly.
- Test your lighting – Colors appear differently in morning sun versus evening light. Check how they appear throughout the day.
The best nursery theme combines your taste with practical needs. Take time to consider these factors before making your final choice.
For themes that grow with your child, explore these[toddler girl bedroom ideas]that offer inspiration beyond the nursery stage.
27 Nursery Theme Ideas for Your Little One
Looking to design a magical space for your baby? This creative and popular nursery theme idea will help you find the perfect style, whether you dream of pastel skies and woodland adventures.
1. Woodland Wonders
Bring the magic of the forest into your baby’s room. Soft browns and greens create a calm feel. Add foxes, owls, and cute mushrooms to walls and bedding. Small touches, such as pine cone decorations or leaf-shaped rugs, work well.
Wood furniture fits this theme perfectly. The nature theme helps babies feel at peace. Parents love this style for its timeless look that grows with children.
2. Jungle Safari
Turn your nursery into a wild adventure with zebras, lions, and monkeys. Green plants and animal prints add fun touches to walls and fabrics. Use tan, brown, and green colors for a natural look.
Stuffed animals make perfect decorations and future playmates. Wall decals of tall trees create depth in small rooms. This theme sparks interest in animals from an early age. Kids enjoy the bright colors and friendly animal faces.
3. Under the Sea
Create a calm water world with shades of blue and green. Fish, whales, and turtles make sweet wall art and mobile options. Wavy patterns on rugs or curtains mimic the movement of water.
Soft lighting gives the feel of being underwater. Small boats or shells make great shelf decorations. This theme has a peaceful effect on babies. The blue tones help create a good sleep space while still feeling fun.
4. Farm Life
Red barns, cute cows, and friendly sheep bring country charm to baby rooms. Checkered patterns and hay bale shapes add texture to the space. A small wooden fence serves as wall art, tying the theme together.
Tractor toys serve as both fun decor and future playthings. The simple shapes of farm animals appeal to young eyes. This theme works well with natural wood furniture. Families with country roots feel at home with farm motifs.
5. Arctic Adventure
Cool blues and crisp whites create a fresh, clean nursery space. Polar bears, seals, and snow-covered trees make sweet decorations. Fuzzy white rugs feel like snow under tiny feet. Soft blue lights give the feel of ice and snow.
This theme offers a clean, open look that feels fresh and modern. The cool colors help hot rooms feel more comfortable. Little ones seem drawn to the clear colors and cute animals.
6. Celestial Skies
Fill the ceiling with stars and moons in soft silver and gold. Dark blue walls make white stars pop and shine. Moon-shaped night lights give off a soft, warm glow.
Cloud pillows and star mobiles add depth and movement. This theme is well-suited for kids as they learn about space. The night sky theme helps create a dreamy sleep space. Parents find this theme works for both boys and girls.
7. Magical Unicorns
Soft purples, pinks, and blues create a sweet, dream-like space. Small unicorn figures and plush toys add fun to shelves and cribs. Rainbow patterns on walls or bedding bring color and joy.
Cloud shapes make perfect wall shelves for books and toys, and light-up stars add a touch of wonder to the room. This happy theme fills a room with hope and joy, and kids often keep their love of this theme well into childhood.
8. Fairy Tale Forest
Mix mushroom shapes, tiny doors, and woodland friends for pure magic. Soft greens and browns make a base for bright flower colors. Tree-shaped wall art brings height and life to flat walls.
Flower-shaped rugs add a pop of color to wood or carpet floors. Tiny fairy lights make the room glow with warmth. This theme lets kids start life in a world of stories. The nature base keeps the room from feeling too busy.
9. Outer Space Explorer
Deep blues and blacks make stars and planets stand out. Rocket ships, stars, and moon shapes are suitable for walls and beds. Glow-in-the-dark stars bring night skies indoors.
Planet mobiles teach basic space facts as they spin. This room is well-suited for curious kids who love science. The vast theme gives a sense of wonder and potential. Even babies seem drawn to the stark color mix.
10. Pastel Circus
Soft pinks, blues, and yellows bring the fun without harsh colors. Tent shapes over cribs or play areas add height and interest. Small animal figures nod to circus friends, such as elephants and lions.
Striped patterns on walls or fabrics give a big-top feel. This theme strikes a balance between fun and calm. The bright theme helps wake up dark rooms. Kids react well to the mix of animals and shapes.
11. Boho Rainbow
Mix warm earth tones with soft, rainbow-shaped elements for a cozy feel. Add woven baskets and wall hangings with tassels for texture. Rattan chairs or lamp shades bring a natural touch.
Macramé plant holders with trailing greenery add life to corners. Layered rugs in muted colors create a warm ambiance underfoot. This style works well with both new and thrift store finds. The casual mix offers a laid-back vibe that feels homey and warm.
12. Neutral Minimalism
Create a calm space with clean lines and a simple color scheme. Stick to whites, creams, and light wood tones throughout the room. Use textures like wool, cotton, and linen to add interest without color.
Keep wall art basic with simple shapes or gentle line drawings. This style makes small rooms feel open and bright. Babies often respond well to the lack of visual noise. The timeless look stays fresh as your child grows.
13. Scandinavian Simplicity
Clean lines and light colors form the base of this cool Nordic style. Mix in wooden toys and furniture with simple shapes. Add soft gray, pale pink, or light blue as gentle color notes.
Use natural materials like cotton, wool, and untreated wood. Wall decals with basic shapes add visual interest without clutter. This style feels fresh and open even in small spaces. The clean look helps create a sense of order and calm.
14. Monochrome Modern
Bold black-and-white patterns create a strong visual impact for new eyes. Simple shapes and clear lines help babies focus and develop their learning skills. Add texture through fuzzy rugs, smooth woods, and soft fabrics.
This high-contrast look aids in early visual development. Small pops of color can be added to break up the two-tone palette if desired. The style works well with a variety of home styles. This theme grows nicely as tastes change with age.
15. Desert Vibes
Warm sand tones and clay colors create a sun-baked feel. Small cacti prints or stuffed plants add life without sharp edges. Round shapes and curved lines soften the desert theme.
Woven wall hangings in rust and orange bring texture to the walls. This theme feels warm and cozy in any season. The earthy tones help create a grounded, calm space. Kids respond well to the natural elements and simple shapes.
16. Little Aviator
Soft blue skies and fluffy clouds set the stage for flying fun. Hang small wooden planes from the ceiling at different heights. Map prints on walls or bedding spark interest in world travel.
Add pilot caps or old-style goggles as wall decor. Keep the blue tones soft for a soothing sleep space. This theme fuels future dreams of flight and far-off places. The sky theme makes rooms feel bigger and more open.
17. Dinosaur Find
Create a time-travel theme with friendly dinos and leafy plants. Mix in earthy browns and greens for a jungle-like feel. Add fossil prints and dinosaur tracks on walls or rugs.
Use stuffed dinosaurs of all sizes as both toys and decor. This theme grows well with children as they learn more about science. The natural colors help create a calm yet fun room. Kids love the mix of real science and playful creatures.
18. Construction Zone
Bright yellow, red, and blue bring work trucks and tools to life. Wall decals of cranes and diggers add action without mess. Small hard hats make cute wall hooks for coats and bags.
Toolbox-shaped storage bins help teach clean-up skills early. This theme works well for active, hands-on kids. The bright colors bring energy to any room, regardless of its size. Parents find that truck lovers often keep this theme for many years.
19. Patchwork Playroom
Mix and match fabric squares in happy colors for a cozy quilt-like feel. Use blocks of color on walls or rugs to echo the patchwork theme. Add simple toys in basic shapes that match your color blocks.
Soft fabric wall hangings bring texture without fuss. This theme allows for easy changes as your child grows. The mix of colors works for any gender. Many parents find this style easy to adapt to other rooms later.
20. Tiny Camper
Bring the great outdoors inside with tent shapes and campfire motifs. Soft browns and greens mimic forest floors and tree canopies. String lights across the ceiling to create a night sky feel.
Add stuffed forest friends, such as bears and foxes, for company. Wall decals of trees add height to the room. This theme works for both boys and girls. The nature focus helps create a sense of calm and wonder.
21. Garden Bloom
Fill the room with soft flower shapes and gentle butterfly motifs. Use fresh greens and soft pinks to create a spring-like feel all year round. Add wall decals of growing vines to develop a sense of height in the room.
Flower-shaped rugs or pillows bring the garden theme to life. This theme helps spaces feel vibrant and full of life. The gentle colors soothe both babies and parents. Natural light works great with this fresh, open theme.
22. Bug & Butterfly Garden
Fill the walls with friendly bugs and bright butterflies for a lively nature scene. Mix in greens, yellows, and colorful flowers for a garden feel. Add leaf-shaped pillows and a flower mobile that moves with air flow.
Butterfly wall stickers add color at different heights. This theme helps children learn about small creatures from an early age. The mix of colors keeps the baby’s eyes busy and happy. Nature sounds work well in this room type.
23. Teddy Bear Picnic
Soft bears of all sizes create a huggable, cozy space. Add checked fabrics in gentle colors for that picnic blanket feel. Use honey pots or small baskets as fun storage for small items.
Flower and grass wall decals set the picnic scene. This theme strikes a balance between playfulness and calmness. The soft toys make the room feel extra cozy and safe. Many kids keep their bear friends well into their school years.
24. Cloud Nine
Soft whites and light grays create an airy, open feel. Paint clouds on walls or hang cloud-shaped wall art. Use fluffy rugs and pillows to bring cloud softness to touch. Light fixtures with cloud shapes cast gentle shadows.
This theme makes small rooms appear larger and more spacious. The simple colors allow for easy changes as tastes grow. Light blues or pinks can be added for subtle color if desired.
25. Crayon Dreams
Bright, rainbow-colored elements in neat rows create a cheerful, creative space. Paint walls in washable finishes to allow for future art projects. Add color block storage bins for a put-together look.
Framed kid art (or simple colorful prints) brings life to walls. This theme is well-suited for art-loving kids. The bright colors help wake up small brains and boost happy feelings. Parents find this theme easy to match with many toy colors.
26. Royal Nursery
Rich purples and golds create a royal feel without too much flash. Add crown wall art or crown-shaped pillows for playful touches. Use plush velvet fabrics for an added sense of luxury.
Drape sheer curtains from the ceiling to the crib to create a canopy effect. This theme feels special while still being warm and cozy. The rich colors work well in both large and small spaces. Children feel valued in a room fit for small royals.
27. French Chic
Soft pinks and creams create a gentle base for French-style prints. Add black accents for that Paris street style pop. Utilize curved furniture shapes to evoke a sense of old-world charm.
French saying wall art adds a touch of culture and style. This theme complements both modern and vintage items well. The style feels both fresh and timeless at once, and the blend of new and old elements works well for many types of homes.
Nursery Themes Based on Color Palettes
Choosing a nursery theme based on color palette is a great way to build a visually cohesive and emotionally resonant space.
Palette Style | Example Themes | Description |
---|---|---|
Dreamy Pastel Nursery Themes | Unicorns, Pastel Circus, Boho Rainbow | Soft, whimsical, and magical, ideal for creating a gentle, dreamlike environment. |
Neutral and Earth-Toned Themes | Scandinavian, Woodland Wonders, Minimalist Beige | Calm, natural, and grounded tones that evoke a warm and timeless feel. |
Bold and Color-Pop Themes | Construction Zone, Safari Adventure, Alphabet & Numbers | Energetic and fun, with high visual stimulation, making it great for learning and play. |
Elegant Gold & Jewel-Tone Themes | Royal Nursery, Art Deco, Luxe Jungle Safari | Rich and glamorous, these colors offer a luxurious and sophisticated vibe. |
Cool & Calm Blues and Greens | Under the Sea, Arctic Adventure, Garden Bloom | Refreshing, peaceful themes that soothe and relax both baby and parent. |
Whatever your color preference, there’s a nursery theme that brings it to life, helping you design a space that’s not just beautiful, but meaningful and calming for your baby.
Conclusion
Choosing a color-based nursery theme extends beyond creating a visually appealing room. The right colors help create a space that grows with your child, making both of you feel happy and calm.
Start with a color family you love, then pick a theme that fits your style. Remember that light colors make small rooms feel bigger, while bold colors add energy to play areas.
Your baby’s first room sets the stage for many special moments, from middle-of-night feedings to first steps.
Trust your gut when making color choices, you know what feels right for your family. What color palette speaks to you most?
Please let me know which theme you’ve chosen for your little one’s space in the comments below!
Frequently Asked Questions
How do I Choose a Nursery Theme?
Pick colors you love, consider room size, consider longevity, match your home style, and, most importantly, choose what makes you smile when you see it.
What Colors Stimulate Babies’ Brains?
Black and white patterns are best for newborns. By 3-4 months, babies respond well to bright primary colors, such as red, yellow, and blue.
Do the Colors of Baby’s Ears Determine Skin?
No, ear color doesn’t determine skin color. Both are influenced by genetics, but ear color alone isn’t a reliable predictor of a baby’s future skin tone.

author: Dan Ralph; The Canadian Press
title: L.A. Lakers mystique was alive and well in '23 on DraftKings' sportsbook in Ontario.
text: TORONTO — The Los Angeles Lakers' mystique was alive and well with Ontario bettors. The Lakers, led by superstar LeBron James, were the second-most bet on team on DraftKings' Ontario sportsbook last year. Only the Toronto Blue Jays drew more action. "The Lakers are a popular team, whether it's the U.S., Canada, Germany, Spain, it doesn't matter," said Johnny Avello, DraftKings' director of race and sports operations. "The team has a big following and has for many years because of all the great players that go through their doors. "You go anywhere and you'll see people wearing Lakers shirts." The Buffalo Bills -- popular in southern Ontario -- held down third spot. The Toronto Maple Leafs were the only other Canadian franchise to make the cut, standing eighth ahead of basketball's Phoenix Suns and football's New York Jets. The Jays (89-73) finished third in the American League East to qualify for the playoffs. However, they were swept 2-0 by the Minnesota Twins in the AL wildcard series. Toronto was the most-bet on World Series team, ahead of the Los Angeles Dodgers and Philadelphia Phillies. The champion Texas Rangers were fourth. Toronto slugger Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was the most bet-on player to win the AL MVP, ahead of New York's Aaron Judge and Texas's Corey Seager. But Anaheim's Shohei Ohtani, the fourth pick, was the runaway winner of the award before signing a mega 10-year, US$700-million free-agent deal with the Dodgers. Avello wasn't surprised to see the Jays atop the list. "When you look at certain jurisdictions where we are, teams in that jurisdiction are bet on more than others," he said. "So that's no surprise." The Toronto Raptors were the seventh-most bet on team to win the NBA crown. The Milwaukee Bucks, Suns and eventual-champion Denver Nuggets held the top three spots. No Raptors were listed as favourites for the NBA's outstanding player award but Hamilton's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander of the Oklahoma City Thunder, was the fourth most-bet on individual by handle. Denver's Nikola Jokic, Boston's Jayson Tatum and Dallas's Luka Doncic were the top-three picks. Toronto's Darko Rajakovic was fourth in betting for the NBA's top coach award. Former Raptors boss Nick Nurse, now with the Philadelphia 76ers, was tops. Last month, Gilgeous-Alexander was named The Canadian Press male athlete of the year. "He is a tremendous player and has been for a few years now," Avello said. "It's not unusual that he'd be bet up there because he's certainly one of your top players in the NBA." Surprisingly, the Cincinnati Bengals were the most bet-on NFL team to win the Super Bowl. Buffalo was second ahead of the San Francisco 49ers (12-4), who've clinched top spot in the NFC. Buffalo (10-6) can secure the AFC East for a fourth straight year with a road win Sunday over Miami. The Dolphins (11-5) have already clinched an NFL playoff spot. "I found that (Cincinnati selection) to be a little surprising," Avello said. 'Buffalo has always been a top choice because it has had a good, competitive team over the last few years and there's also the proximity to Canada. "But the Bengals have had a good team knocking on the door so I think this was about value . . . going for a double-digit underdog and trying to get a better price for your buck. I don't blame (bettors) because going into the season I thought Cincinnati would also contend for the title but unfortunately when you lose (quarterback) Joe Burrow and a couple of receivers . . . it was just a bad overall year for Cincinnati." Buffalo quarterback Josh Allen was the third pick for the NFL's most valuable player award behind San Francisco's Brock Purdy and Dallas's Dak Prescott. Lamar Jackson, who has led Baltimore (13-3) to top spot in the AFC and emerged as the favourite to win the honour for a second time, was initially ninth. Ontario bettors made the Maple Leafs the most bet-on team to win the Stanley Cup. Edmonton was No. 2 ahead of Las Vegas, last year's champion. Toronto last won the Stanley Cup in 1967. "Toronto has been there, it has had great, outstanding regular-season records, it just hasn't been able to get far enough," Avello said. "I think it (Leafs topping list) should be." The Vancouver Canucks were fifth, ahead of the Ottawa Senators (sixth). Rick Tocchet, in his first full season behind Vancouver's bench, was the top selection to win the Jack Adams Trophy as the NHL's top coach. The Canucks (24-11-3, 51 points) currently top the Pacific Conference. Peter Laviolette of the New York Rangers (26-10-1, 53 points) and Mike Sullivan of the Pittsburgh Penguins (19-14-4, 42 points) were the other top two candidates. "Obviously it makes sense that (Tocchet) would get bet," Avello said. "But (Laviolette) is also a good choice and value play. "That was probably bet more toward the beginning of the year so I see that also as a very smart play by bettors." This report by The Canadian Press was first published Jan. 5, 2024. Dan Ralph, The Canadian Press

author: Seleções
title: Descubra os benefícios da manteiga de karité para pele e cabelo
text:
Explore os inúmeros benefícios da manteiga de karité para a
 saúde e beleza da pele e do cabelo
. Conhecida por suas propriedades hidratantes e nutritivas, a manteiga de karité oferece uma experiência única de cuidados,
proporcionando maciez, brilho e revitalização
. Descubra como esse ingrediente natural se tornou um aliado essencial para a beleza, sendo responsável por uma pele radiante e cabelos saudáveis.
Vamos então nos
 aprofundar nos segredos dessa manteiga versátil
para que você possa desfrutar dos resultados incríveis que ela pode proporcionar à sua rotina de cuidados pessoais. Confira os benefícios da manteiga de karité para pele e cabelo.
Leia também:
Cabelos secos e ressecados: entenda a diferença.
O que é para o quê serve a manteiga de karité?
Originária da África Ocidental, a árvore de karité ganha destaque por produzir frutos dos quais é extraída a densa e altamente nutritiva manteiga de karité, uma manteiga vegetal reconhecida por suas propriedades benéficas. Além de desempenhar um papel fundamental na indústria cosmética e culinária, o karité é de grande importância para as economias e culturas locais, servindo como fonte de renda essencial para comunidades envolvidas na coleta e processamento de suas valiosas nozes.
O processo envolve a prensagem das nozes para extrair um óleo que, ao solidificar, transforma-se na renomada manteiga de karité. Esse produto é abundante em vitaminas e antioxidantes, oferecendo benefícios excepcionais para os cuidados com a pele.
E para que serve a manteiga de karité?
A manteiga de karité é uma substância hidratante de origem vegetal, conhecida por suas propriedades nutritivas e emolientes. Seu uso primário está associado aos cuidados com a pele e cabelo , dada sua gama de benefícios.
Além de seu emprego em produtos de beleza, o karité também é aproveitado na culinária. O óleo extraído das nozes é utilizado na preparação de alimentos, bem como na produção de chocolates e outros itens alimentícios.
Devido à sua riqueza em nutrientes, incluindo vitaminas A e E, ácidos graxos e triglicerídeos, a manteiga de karité torna-se um componente essencial na rotina de cuidados com a pele. Presente em diversos produtos, como hidratantes corporais, formulações faciais, cremes para mãos e máscaras capilares, a manteiga de karité oferece uma aplicação versátil.
Benefícios da manteiga de karité
A manteiga de karité, há séculos utilizada em cosméticos, oferece hidratação intensa para pele e cabelos. Sua capacidade de ser profundamente absorvida cria uma barreira protetora, prevenindo a perda de umidade e mantendo a pele suave e radiante. Rica em vitaminas e nutrientes, promove a regeneração celular, atua como antioxidante contra rugas e linhas de expressão, e possui propriedades anti-inflamatórias que acalmam a pele sensível, reduzindo a vermelhidão.
Além disso, o karité é eficaz no tratamento de condições dermatológicas como eczema, psoríase e alergias, proporcionando alívio mesmo para peles secas. Surpreendentemente, é adequado para peles oleosas, sendo menos comedogênico e contribuindo para a hidratação equilibrada. Investir nos benefícios profundos da manteiga de karité não só restaura a umidade e suaviza a pele, mas também proporciona conforto e previne o aspecto ressecado, independentemente do tipo de pele.
Nos cabelos
A manteiga de karité proporciona maciez, brilho e nutrição aos cabelos, sendo aplicada pura para umectação, misturada a máscaras de tratamento ou encontrada em produtos capilares prontos. Seja qual for a escolha, a manteiga de karité retém a umidade, nutre fios secos e quebradiços, resultando em cabelos sem frizz e revitalizados.
Nos lábios
A manteiga de karité, embora menos conhecida por essa função, é altamente nutritiva para os lábios, atuando como um bálsamo natural. Seja em forma pura ou como ingrediente em protetores labiais, ela cria uma barreira protetora, retendo a umidade e prevenindo o ressecamento, além de proporcionar proteção contra os raios solares. O uso diário é recomendado para lábios macios e hidratados.
Na pele
A manteiga de karité é uma aliada poderosa para a hidratação da pele, proporcionando maciez e brilho duradouros. Sua absorção profunda mantém a pele suave, oferecendo benefícios semelhantes aos do protetor solar, protegendo contra os raios UV.
Para otimizar seus efeitos, escolha cremes hidratantes ou sabonetes líquidos com karité e aplique diariamente no corpo. Dê atenção especial a áreas ressecadas, como joelhos e cotovelos.
E aí, curtiu essa matéria? Então conheça e siga a gente em nossos perfis no
Pinterest
para conferir muito mais!

author: Correio do Povo
title: Mais de mil crianças não receberam o nome do pai no registro de nascimento em Porto Alegre
text: Mais de mil crianças não receberam o nome do pai no registro de nascimento em Porto Alegre Número cresce mesmo diante da queda de nascimentos no país, conforme dados da Central de Informações do Registro Civil publicidade Mais de 1,1 mil recém-nascidos de 2023 não tiveram a paternidade registrada, conforme dados da Central de Informações do Registro Civil (CRC). Ter o nome do pai na certidão de nascimento considerada a garantia de uma série de direitos para as crianças brasileiras. Além do benefício afetivo que a paternidade possibilita, ela permite o acesso a uma série de prerrogativas, como pensão alimentícia, herança, inclusão em planos de saúde e de previdência, entre outros. Os dados revelam que a realidade tem sido negada para um número cada vez maior de porto-alegrenses e que, em 2023, totalizou 1.177 mil recém-nascidos sem a paternidade registrada, um aumento de 22,9% em relação a 2022, quando foram 958 o número de registros sem o nome do pai. Mesmo com esforços de entes públicos e privados, assim como mudanças na legislação que possibilitam o reconhecimento de paternidade direto em Cartório – sem a necessidade de procedimento judicial -, além da paternidade socioafetiva, o número de crianças sem o nome do pai no registro de nascimento tem crescido ano após ano, mesmo com a diminuição constante do número de nascimentos. Dados da CRC mostram que entre 2016 e 2023, o número de nascimentos aumentou 9,5% em Porto Alegre, enquanto a quantidade de crianças sem o nome do pai no registro cresceu 69,1%. O presidente da Associação Nacional dos Registradores de Pessoas Naturais do Rio Grande do Sul (Arpen/RS), Sidnei Hofer Birmann, afirma que os Cartórios do Estado vêm cumprindo com o seu papel de orientar sobre a importância do nome do pai no registro de nascimento e a facilidade do procedimento, que pode ser realizado sem a necessidade de ação judicial, diretamente em Cartório. Porém. “Mesmo assim não tem sido suficiente para estancar este problema grave da sociedade gaúcha”, explica. Uma nova proposta para tentar enfrentar o problema surgiu durante os debates do novo Código Civil neste ano. O anteprojeto elaborado por uma Comissão de Juristas e entregue para análise do Congresso Nacional, prevê o registro imediato da paternidade a partir da declaração da mãe quando o pai se recusar a realizar o exame de DNA. Paternidade Biológica Além dos meios judiciais, envolvendo exames de DNA, o procedimento de reconhecimento de paternidade também pode ser feito diretamente em qualquer Cartório de Registro Civil, não sendo necessária decisão judicial nos casos em que todas as partes concordam com a resolução. Nos casos em que iniciativa seja do próprio pai, basta que ele compareça ao Cartório com a cópia da certidão de nascimento do filho, sendo necessária a concordância da mãe ou do próprio filho, caso este seja maior de idade. Em caso de filho menor, é necessário a anuência da mãe. Caso o pai não queira reconhecer o filho, a mãe pode fazer a indicação do suposto pai no próprio Cartório, que comunicará aos órgãos competentes para que seja iniciado o processo de investigação de paternidade. Paternidade Socioafetiva Desde 2017 também é possível realizar em Cartório de Registro Civil o reconhecimento de paternidade socioafetiva, aquele onde os pais criam uma criança mediante uma relação de afeto, sem nenhum vínculo biológico, desde que haja a concordância da mãe e do pai biológico. Nestes casos, o procedimento pode ser feitos direto em Cartório quando a criança é maior de 12 anos. Caberá ao registrador civil, mediante a apresentação de documentos e entrevistas com os envolvidos, atestar a existência do vínculo afetivo da paternidade ou maternidade.
